intro: Siphocampylus tillettii, commonly known as the Tillett's siphocampylus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes familiar plants like carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils at high altitudes. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
